result.execSummary:
All charges against Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres appeared by video means with Attorney who appeared in person.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Final Pretrial held.  Parties advise Court they remain in trial posture and have no pretrial motion at this time.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 9/26/2022 at 9:00am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Case is in contest posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with BBC (DOB 6.14.1959)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres
Current: 4022 N 86th St, Milwaukee, WI 53222   (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: 3955A North 86th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53222

Defendant Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carmen Mary Pickett-Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
